column4: so there is no possible way to get the data off of the dvd's i swear im never touching windows again >.<
so theres no way to get the data off the dvd-rw without vista?
can you not mount them manually?
i don't know how to do that can you assist me
try opening them with k3b, it should at least tell you the kind of data contained within
open a terminal and type sudo -i
from there type mount /dev/dvd /mnt
then type ls /mnt
i love you man...it worked flawlessly its mounted read only but i don't care ^_^
good job
not vista then ;)
it's a really sad os...i feel bad for the people that got stuck with it on there dell's and don't know what to do about windows ME II
ok i put the next disk in but it still shows the files from the previous disk?
you will have to run umount /mnt
then run the other command again with the new disk in
really, the disks should be mounted automatically when you insert them in ubuntu
for future reference, there is a nice panel applet that you can add to the the gnome-panel by right clicking it and selecting "add to panel", from there select the disk mounter applet and hit add
what is the app called?
disk mounter
it's in the "add to panel" menu
it's not showing the disk icon in the bar O-o
did you get the disk mounter working?
for some reason the little app isen't showing up not sure why
odd
